text.0: bright splendid like dawns lover he hath filled the two joined worlds as with the light of heaven.
text.1: when born with might thou hast encompassed them father of gods and yet their son wast thou.
text.2: agni the sage the humble who discerns like the cows udder the sweet taste of food.
text.3: like a blissgiver to be drawn to men sits gracious in the middle of the house.
text.4: born in the dwelling like a lovely son pleased like a strong steed he bears on the folk.
text.5: what time the men and i with heroes call may agni then gain all through godlike power.
text.6: none breaks these holy laws of thine when thou hast granted audience to these chieftains here.
text.7: this is thy boast thou smotest with thy peers and joined with heroes dravest off disgrace.
text.8: like the dawns lover spreading light wellknown as hued like morn may he remember me.
text.9: they bearing of themselves unbar the doors they all ascend to the fair place of heaven.
